newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: LCI Computer buys Prodata Systems.
newsitem.headline: LCI Computer buys Prodata Systems.

text.p: LCI Computer Group NV said on Wednesday it had concluded the purchase of the entire share capital of Prodata Systems NV of Belgium.
With the acquisition, LCI's turnover in Belgium will surpass one billion Belgium francs.
The acquisition is financed by cash and shares, spread over the next three years, it said.
LCI Computer said: "As result of the positive performance of previously purchased companies and the maturity of share option plans, LCI will issue 657,500 new shares through a private placement."
LCI Computers closed at 14,25 guilders per share on Tuesday.
LCI also said it had concluded a subordinated loan of 10 million guilders with the Nationale Investeringsbank NV.
"The development of the SmartPen (the unique pen computer) progresses as scheduled," it said.

"In order to fund the planned acquisitions and to continue the development of long range products, LCI and De nationale Investeringsbank have concluded a subordinated loan of 10 million guilders," it said.
